repositories.brief_summary: Seven PRs merged including String module enhancements, ld.conf relocatability improvements, and atomic record fields support
repositories.new_features_summary: New String predicates, external types documentation, relocatable ld.conf, native dynlink cleanup, debugger error messages
repositories.new_features:
- Added **String.{drop,take,cut}_{first,last}_while** functions for predicate-based string splitting operations in both `String` and `StringLabels` modules ([#14362](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14362))
- Implemented **atomic record fields** enabling lock-free concurrent programming with per-field atomic operations ([#13404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13404))
- Enhanced **native dynlink** to call `dlclose` on dynamically loaded objects when errors occur, preventing resource leaks ([#14391](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14391))
- Improved **debugger error messages** to display specific information about incorrect or missing magic numbers rather than generic errors ([#14375](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14375))
- Introduced **relocatable OCaml installations** with explicit relative paths in `ld.conf` - paths like `.` and `..` now resolve relative to the ld.conf directory, and the default ld.conf uses relative rather than absolute paths ([#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243))
- Added **--with-additional-stublibsdir** configure option to prepend custom directories to ld.conf, and stublibs subdirectory is no longer created when building with --disable-shared ([#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243))
- Implemented **multiple ld.conf loading** - the runtime now loads from all of $OCAMLLIB/ld.conf, $CAMLLIB/ld.conf, and standard_library_default/ld.conf rather than just the first found ([#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243))
- Added **external types documentation** - new manual chapter explaining external types for FFI-populated values with examples for predefined types like float, string, and array ([#13994](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13994))
- Updated **GADT tutorial** in manual to avoid using abstract types as indices, demonstrating proper usage with external types ([#13994](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13994))
- Enhanced **ld.conf parsing** robustness - now handles CRLF line endings consistently on both Windows and Unix, and ocamlc uses the same C primitive-based parser as the runtime ([#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243))
- Documented **Ptype_external** in parsetree.mli to clarify the AST representation of external type declarations ([#13994](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13994))
repositories.activity_summary: Active development with 36 open PRs including relocatable OCaml series, atomic operations, String enhancements, and compiler improvements
repositories.activity:
- **Relocatable OCaml initiative** by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) with merged foundation ([#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243)) and four follow-up PRs for --with-relative-libdir ([#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244)), searching and suffixing ([#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245)), opam integration ([#14246](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14246)), and switch management ([#14247](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14247))
- **Atomic operations expansion** including merged atomic record fields by [@clef-men](https://github.com/clef-men) ([#13404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13404)), open atomic arrays PR ([#14380](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14380)), and [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) working on Atomic.modify/modify_get ([#10798](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/10798)), concurrent lazy thunks with Lazy.Atomic_repeating ([#14043](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14043)) and Lazy.Concurrent_blocking ([#14393](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14393))
- **String module enhancements** by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) with merged predicate-based functions ([#14362](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14362)) and open PR adding find_{first,last}_index and related search functions ([#14381](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14381))
- **Compiler tooling improvements** including [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) advancing structured diagnostics ([#13766](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13766)), spellchecking hints for module errors ([#14330](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14330)), and cmt file environment stripping ([#14373](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14373))
- **Type system enhancements** with [@Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) refactoring type_let into separate nonrec/rec functions ([#14394](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14394)) and removing let rec module support ([#14388](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14388)), plus [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) adding Set/Map.S.get_singleton ([#14121](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14121))
- **Pattern matching improvements** by [@Alex1005a](https://github.com/Alex1005a) fixing exhaustiveness checking for GADTs indexed by non-overlapping polymorphic variants ([#14379](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14379))
- **Developer experience** with [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) adding AI.md guidelines ([#14383](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14383)), [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) improving Git source archives ([#14152](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14152)), and [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) integrating Merlin typing recovery ([#14241](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14241))
- **Runtime and GC work** including [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) using memprof status field for minimal sampling ([#14384](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14384)), [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) updating young-pointers after barrier ([#14306](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14306)), and [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) adding named GC parameters mechanism ([#14367](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14367))
- **Platform compatibility** with [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) fixing Windows socketpair AF_UNIX emulation ([#13450](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13450)) and improving AsciiDoc documentation ([#14392](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14392)), [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) updating shell scripts to use /usr/bin/env bash ([#14398](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14398)), and [Samuel Bronson](https://github.com/SamB) checking getentropy declaration ([#14382](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14382))
- **API additions and fixes** including [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) prettifying Filename.quote output on Unix ([#14378](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14378)), [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) fixing inclusion check error messages ([#14205](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14205)), and [@am](https://github.com/agle) documenting Iarray.t construction from array literals ([#14397](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14397))
- **Ongoing long-term initiatives** including [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) on modular explicits ([#13275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13275)), [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) allowing arbitrary structure items in let expressions ([#14040](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14040)), [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) using opaque types for Dynarray.Dummy ([#14084](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14084)), and [Takafumi Saikawa](https://github.com/t6s) enabling -i-variance for classes and extension constructors ([#14315](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14315))
repositories.discussions_summary: String module improvements proposal and TODO.md update discussion
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **String module enhancement proposal** by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) discussing comprehensive improvements to the String API, which led to merged PRs [#14362](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14362) and ongoing work in [#14381](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14381) ([#14137](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/discussions/14137))
- **TODO.md maintenance** discussion by [@TimeForTypes](https://github.com/TimeForTypes) about updating project task tracking documentation ([#14361](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/discussions/14361))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on relocatable installations, concurrent programming primitives, developer tooling, and standard library ergonomics
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Relocatable OCaml** becoming a major focus with comprehensive work spanning build system, installation, and package management to enable portable OCaml installations across different directory structures ([#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243), [#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244), [#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245), [#14246](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14246), [#14247](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14247))
- **Concurrent programming primitives** expanding with atomic record fields merged, atomic arrays in development, and multiple concurrent lazy evaluation strategies being explored for lock-free data structures ([#13404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13404), [#14380](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14380), [#14043](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14043), [#14393](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14393), [#10798](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/10798))
- **Standard library ergonomics** improving with systematic additions to String module for common text processing operations, reflecting broader effort to make standard library more practical ([#14362](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14362), [#14381](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14381), [#14137](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/discussions/14137))
- **Developer experience focus** with structured diagnostics, better error messages, spellchecking hints, and IDE integration improvements making the compiler more helpful and approachable ([#13766](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13766), [#14330](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14330), [#14241](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14241), [#14205](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14205))
- **Documentation completeness** addressing gaps in manual coverage of language features, particularly around external types, GADTs, and newer additions like immutable arrays ([#13994](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13994), [#14397](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14397), [#14386](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14386))
- **AI-assisted contribution guidelines** emerging with dedicated documentation to help contributors use AI tools effectively while maintaining code quality standards ([#14383](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14383), [#14052](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14052))
repositories.issues_summary: Documentation gap for Iarray type-disambiguated literals identified as good first issue
repositories.good_first_issues: - **Iarray documentation enhancement** - add mention of how to construct immutable arrays using type-disambiguated array literals `[: 1; 2; 3 :]` in the module introduction, reported by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) ([#14386](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14386))

repositories.brief_summary: opam 2.5.0 final release with performance improvements and init config error handling enhancements
repositories.new_features_summary: Error messages for invalid config files, performance optimizations in version comparison and cache loading
repositories.new_features:
- Improved **error handling** for `opam init --config` command now displays clear error messages when the specified file does not exist or is in a version control system, replacing confusing assertion failures ([#5979](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5979))
- **Performance optimizations** in core string comparison and version comparison functions eliminating memory allocations, plus OCaml 5.4-specific cache loading improvements using `Gc.ramp_up` ([#6515](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6515))
- **Installation script** updated with opam 2.5.0 checksums and version information for all supported platforms ([#6817](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6817))
repositories.activity_summary: Shell completion environment variables and documentation API improvements under review, opam show optimization in progress
repositories.activity:
- [Brian Ward](https://github.com/WardBrian) opened PR for **shell completion environment variables** setting `XDG_DATA_DIRS` and `FPATH` in `opam env` to enable bash and zsh completions automatically ([#6812](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6812))
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) opened PR for `opam show` **I/O optimization** reducing switch selection reads when displaying multiple package versions ([#6818](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6818))
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) opened documentation PR replacing outdated API example with **direct link to API documentation** ([#6809](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6809))
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) opened PR to filter man2html processing to only **actual man pages** preventing empty files in documentation output ([#6807](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6807))
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) updated **changelog and documentation** following the 2.5.0 release with GHA workflow adjustments ([#6821](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6821))
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) continues work on **repos-config syntax** redesign making repository configuration more maintainable with labeled fields for URL, fingerprints, and quorum, though conflicts need resolution ([#6393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6393))
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) progressing on **HTTP repository performance** redesign using tar.gz files directly rather than unpacking, aiming to reduce opam init/update time especially on Windows and network filesystems ([#6625](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6625))
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) merged **gitignore cleanup** sorting and updating ignored patterns ([#6819](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6819))
- [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) merged **GitHub Actions update** bumping actions/checkout from v5 to v6 ([#6811](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6811))
repositories.discussions_summary: Environment hook aggressiveness, sandboxing on KDE Neon, repository warnings, and variable support in extra-source
repositories.notable_discussions:
- [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) raised concerns about **env_hook aggressiveness** where `PROMPT_COMMAND` integration forces opam binary paths to dominate `$PATH` preventing users from overriding with custom directories, proposing direnv-style differential updates ([#6815](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6815))
- [珊瑚](https://github.com/sanette) reported **sandboxing failure on KDE Neon 24.04** with bwrap loopback error, resolved by removing AppArmor profile, highlighting stricter security policies in KDE Neon affecting bubblewrap ([#6820](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6820))
- [Reynir Björnsson](https://github.com/reynir) suggested **warning when creating switches without default repository** to prevent confusing "unknown package" errors that occur when users have removed the default repository ([#6816](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6816))
- [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) requested **variable support in extra-source fields** to enable version interpolation in source URLs, with [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) noting this would require x-* extension fields or opam 3.x due to syntax changes ([#6801](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6801))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on environment management refinement, platform compatibility fixes, and user experience improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Environment management refinement** emerging as key concern with discussions about env_hook behavior ([#6815](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6815)), shell completion variables ([#6812](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6812)), and stale environment variables from nuked roots ([#6455](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6455))
- **Platform-specific compatibility** receiving attention with AppArmor issues on KDE Neon ([#6820](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6820)), MSYS2 build failures ([#6803](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6803)), and ongoing Windows portability work
- **Performance optimization** continuing with allocation-free version comparison ([#6515](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6515)), opam show I/O reduction ([#6818](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6818)), and HTTP repository structure redesign ([#6625](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6625))
- **User experience improvements** through better error messages ([#5979](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/5979), [#6814](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6814)), clearer warnings ([#6816](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6816)), and documentation refinements ([#6809](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6809))
repositories.contributors_summary: Six merged PRs and seven new PRs from five contributors including release work, optimizations, and tooling updates
repositories.contributors:

Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) merged gitignore cleanup ([#6819](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6819)), opened opam show optimization PR ([#6818](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6818)), provided code review and testing for performance improvements ([#6515](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6515)), continues repos-config syntax redesign ([#6393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6393)), and opened issue about opam init error handling improvements ([#6814](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6814))
- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) contributed **performance optimizations** making version comparison and string comparison allocation-free plus OCaml 5.4 cache loading improvements merged in ([#6515](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6515))
- [Brian Ward](https://github.com/WardBrian) opened PR adding **shell completion environment variables** for bash and zsh integration ([#6812](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6812))
- [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) automated GitHub Actions maintenance bumping checkout action to v6 ([#6811](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6811))
- [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) opened detailed issue about env_hook PATH behavior ([#6815](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6815))
- [珊瑚](https://github.com/sanette) reported and helped diagnose sandboxing issues on KDE Neon ([#6820](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6820))
- [Reynir Björnsson](https://github.com/reynir) opened issue requesting warnings for switches without repositories ([#6816](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6816))
- [Sergey Fedorov](https://github.com/barracuda156) reported Dune regression affecting opam 2.5.0 builds on macOS 10.6.8 ([#6822](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6822))
- [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) requested extra-source variable interpolation feature ([#6801](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6801))

repositories.brief_summary: Improved .merlin fallback support and added Dune package management installation instructions
repositories.new_features_summary: Natural .merlin fallback when dune-project is absent, improved documentation for Dune pkg installation
repositories.new_features:
- **Fallback on `.merlin` configuration** if no `dune-project` file is found and `dot-merlin-reader` is installed, removing the need for the `--fallback-read-dot-merlin` flag in non-Dune projects ([#1563](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1563), fixes [#1522](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1522))
- **Installation instructions for Dune package management** with `dune tools install ocamllsp` command for local project installations, including editor integration guidance for VSCode and Emacs ([#1573](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1573))
repositories.activity_summary: Backport PR for OCaml 4.14 support opened, Stdune refactoring continues with three PRs merged
repositories.activity:
- **New PR opened** for updating the 4.14 branch with features from master including Yojson 3 compatibility, hover fixes, configurable code-lens, ocamlformat-mlx support, and Stdune removal by [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) ([#1574](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1574)), with review feedback from [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) about using merlin-lib 4.19-414 instead of 4.18

repositories.trends_summary: Ongoing effort to reduce external dependencies by removing Stdune across multiple modules
repositories.emerging_trends:

- **Improved installation documentation** with focus on modern package management workflows, particularly Dune's local project installation approach that ensures compiler version compatibility ([#1573](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1573))

repositories.brief_summary: Rocq Prover support added, Coq mode deprecated, new promotion show command, compiler warning defaults changed
repositories.new_features_summary: Rocq build language, dune promotion show command, compiler warning variable, SSH repository URLs, dev-tool lock dir variable
repositories.new_features:
- **Rocq Prover build language** support via `(lang rocq)` for Rocq 9.0 and later, providing similar functionality to `(lang coq)` without requiring `coq*` compatibility wrappers ([#12035](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12035))
- **Coq mode deprecation** in favor of Rocq mode, with development frozen on `(lang coq)` which will be removed in future versions ([#12793](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12793))
- **`dune promotion show` command** to preview corrected files before promotion, accepting file arguments or displaying all promotable files ([#12669](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12669))
- **`dune rocq top` command** to execute Rocq toplevel with local configuration ([f783f81](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/f783f81731da4ecb307981bc61117f07c1b3b953))
- **Compiler warning defaults changed** for Dune language 3.21+ to match OCaml compiler defaults, with `%{dune-warnings}` variable available to restore previous stricter warning set ([#12766](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12766))
- **SSH repository URLs** documentation for Git-based package repositories in workspace files ([#12790](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12790))
- **Dev-tool lock directory variable** `%{dev-tool-lock-dir}` added to reference lock directory location ([#12779](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12779))
- **Dev-tool lock directories** moved into hidden `.dune/dev-tools-locks/` folder by default ([#12671](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12671))
- **Improved error messages** for invalid version strings in `dune-project` files with helpful hints showing correct format ([#12794](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12794))
- **Module compilation dependency fix** adding dependency to original source file ([#12774](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12774))
- **Unused libraries detection** improvements for runtime dependencies ([#12786](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12786), [#12807](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12807))
- **Cram stanza empty match** fix when cram stanza applies to no files ([#12814](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12814))
- **Action builder alias module** refactoring ([#12772](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12772))
- **Read-only promotion revert** reverting changes that made promoted files read-only ([#12808](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12808))
- **Documentation improvements** including dune-workspace syntax highlighting ([#12803](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12803)), opam-alongside-pkg workflow guide ([#12761](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12761)), variable reference updates, and repository SSH URL documentation
- **Unused experimental libraries removed** including dune-*-experimental packages ([#12765](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12765), [#12823](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12823))
- **GitHub Actions updates** with actions/checkout bumped from 5 to 6 ([#12778](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12778))
- **Re-exports bug demonstration** test case added ([#12783](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12783))
- **Config comparison fix** for incorrect configuration comparisons ([#12781](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12781))
repositories.activity_summary: Package management focus with 17 new PRs including improved error messages, delayed URL resolution, and extensive documentation requests
repositories.activity:
- **Seventeen new PRs opened** this week including delayed URL resolution for package management by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([#12829](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12829)), parameterised rules delay args ([#12824](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12824)), Dune language version update to 3.21 in docs ([#12817](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12817)), improved error messages for `(pkg enabled)` in dune-project by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) ([#12802](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12802)), editor configuration documentation pointers ([#12810](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12810)), library dependency fix in dune init ([#12791](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12791)), cram partial promotions test ([#12789](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12789)), network caps for tracking network access ([#12787](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12787)), and OxCaml project setup documentation by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) ([#12780](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12780))
- **Rocq Prover integration completed** with [Emilio Jesús Gallego Arias](https://github.com/ejgallego) merging the comprehensive `(lang rocq)` implementation adding 11,282 lines across 687 files including theory stanzas, documentation, and test suite ([#12035](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12035)), followed by deprecation of Coq mode ([#12793](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12793))
- **Package management infrastructure improvements** by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) and [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV) including dev-tool lock directory relocation to hidden folder ([#12671](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12671)), variable for lock dir location ([#12779](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12779)), and SSH repository URL documentation by [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) ([#12790](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12790))
- **Compiler behavior change** with [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) stopping Dune from changing default compiler warning set for language version 3.21+, providing `%{dune-warnings}` variable for users preferring stricter warnings ([#12766](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12766))
- **Promotion workflow enhancement** by [@MixiMaxiMouse](https://github.com/MixiMaxiMouse) adding `dune promotion show` command to preview changes before promoting files ([#12669](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12669))
- **Error message improvements** by [Sachin Beniwal](https://github.com/benodiwal) fixing crash and improving hints for non-ASCII version strings in dune-project files ([#12794](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12794))
- **Build correctness fixes** including module compilation dependencies to original source files ([#12774](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12774)), unused libraries runtime deps handling ([#12786](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12786), [#12807](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12807)), and cram stanza empty match fix ([#12814](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12814))
- **Read-only promotion reverted** by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) after identifying issues with the feature ([#12808](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12808))
- **Documentation enhancements** including dune-workspace syntax highlighting ([#12803](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12803)), opam-alongside-pkg workflow guide by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) ([#12761](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12761)), and various typo fixes ([#12805](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12805))
- **Code maintenance** removing unused experimental libraries ([#12765](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12765), [#12823](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12823)) and updating GitHub Actions dependencies ([#12778](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12778))

repositories.trends_summary: Package management maturation with focus on UX, documentation, and error messages; Rocq transition from Coq; compiler default alignment
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Package management maturation** with 12 new issues and 6 closed issues focusing on user experience improvements including CLI enhancements for enabling/disabling package management ([#12819](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12819)), dependency download notifications ([#12828](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12828)), selective package upgrades ([#12820](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12820)), and better error messaging ([#12801](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12801))
- **Documentation expansion** with 6 new documentation requests and multiple merged documentation PRs addressing workflow guides ([#12761](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12761)), environment variables ([#12792](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12792)), SSH repository URLs ([#12790](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12790)), and dev-tool configuration ([#12798](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12798))
- **Rocq Prover transition** marking a shift from Coq with comprehensive new language support ([#12035](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12035)), formal deprecation of Coq mode ([#12793](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12793)), and planned removal timeline discussion ([#12788](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12788))
- **Compiler alignment** reverting Dune's custom warning defaults to match OCaml compiler behavior for version 3.21+, reducing Dune-specific conventions ([#12766](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12766))
- **Dev-tool lock directory improvements** completing multi-issue effort to move lock directories into hidden folders ([#12671](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12671)) closing long-standing issues about lock directory management ([#10955](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/10955), [#12097](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12097))
- **Long-standing issue closures** including 5-year-old promotion preview request ([#3883](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/3883)), 1.5-year lock directory specialization ([#10743](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/10743)), and SSH repository URL support ([#12701](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12701))
- **Error message quality focus** with improvements for non-ASCII versions ([#12794](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12794)), package management configuration ([#12802](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12802)), and Unicode position handling ([#12806](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12806))

repositories.brief_summary: Language committee governance improvements merged alongside active discussions on `val` declarations and tuple projections
repositories.new_features_summary: Added conflict-of-interest policy and affiliation tracking for OCaml Language Committee members
repositories.new_features:
- **Transparency policy for conflicts of interest** added to the OCaml Language Committee governance, requiring members to disclose conflicts when they belong to the same institution as proposal submitters or have financial ties, and establishing that conflicted members cannot serve as shepherds ([#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/55), [081221f](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/commit/081221febd0670f91de3e0714dcb43ea5be7b4d1))
- **Affiliation field** added to the committee member table, documenting institutional affiliations including Inria Paris, Jane Street, LexiFi, Meta, and University of Cambridge ([#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/55))
repositories.activity_summary: New RFC proposing `val` declarations in structures, with ongoing discussions on tuple projections and atomic record fields
repositories.activity:
- **New RFC for `val` declarations in structures** opened by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) proposing syntax to write type signatures alongside definitions, similar to Haskell-style type annotations, sparking extensive discussion about forward declarations, scoping semantics, and integration with mutual recursion ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- **Language committee conflict-of-interest policy** merged by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron), establishing transparency requirements for committee deliberations and adding institutional affiliation disclosure ([#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/55))
- **Tuple projections RFC** continues with active debate between [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) and maintainers about whether unlabeled numeric projections should require tuple polymorphism or rely on known type information, with consensus favoring polymorphic approach for unlabeled projections ([#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57))
- **Uniform arrays proposal** received implementation feedback from [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) suggesting a more general signature for `Array.Floatarray` module using private types ([#37](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/37))
- **Atomic record fields RFC** updated with note about atomic arrays implementation, cross-referencing [ocaml/ocaml#14380](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14380) ([#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/39))
repositories.discussions_summary: `val` declarations RFC sparked debate on forward declarations vs. type ascriptions, with alternative interpretations proposed
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Forward declarations vs. type ascriptions** debated extensively for `val` declarations, with [Jeremy Yallop](https://github.com/yallop) proposing an alternative interpretation where `val` serves as forward declarations to introduce recursion (similar to Agda), enabling recursive bindings between different kinds of items like types and modules, while [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) proposed that `val` should primarily serve as type ascriptions that don't introduce recursion ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- **Scoping semantics for `val` bindings** discussed with [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) proposing that forward declarations should be removed from scope in the next definition to avoid unintended recursive references, while others debated whether this creates confusing semantics ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- **Syntax placement preferences** emerged with [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) advocating for `val` declarations to immediately precede their corresponding `let` or `and` bindings rather than being grouped at the top, viewing this as syntactic sugar for type constraints that improves code legibility ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- **Alternative syntaxes** proposed including [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25)'s `val rec` keyword to explicitly mark forward declarations that introduce recursion, and [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere)'s unordered `and`-joined blocks mixing `val`, `let`, and `let rec` declarations ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- **Locally abstract types in signatures** questioned by [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) regarding scoping across `val` and `let` boundaries, expressing concerns about "spooky action at a distance" similar to Haskell's deprecated `-XScopedTypeVariables` extension ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- **Tuple polymorphism implementation challenges** raised by [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) questioning how runtime projection would work for flexible tuples with labeled and unlabeled fields, asking whether canonical ordering or dynamic lookup would be required ([#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57))
- **Type inference complexity** debated with [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) arguing that tuple polymorphism would be invasive to the type checker and preferring improvements to known-type-information propagation instead, while maintainers indicated numeric projections without polymorphism are non-intuitive ([#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57))
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Type system expressiveness** features gaining momentum with proposals for `val` declarations, tuple projections, and atomic record fields all aiming to make OCaml's type system more expressive while maintaining backward compatibility and ergonomic syntax ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59), [#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57), [#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/39))
- **Governance transparency** improvements formalized with the conflict-of-interest policy reflecting the committee's effort to balance community representation while being explicit about institutional affiliations and potential biases ([#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/55))
- **Type-level polymorphism** discussions revealing tension between implementation complexity and user expectations, with tuple polymorphism debate highlighting trade-offs between type inference sophistication and maintainability ([#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57))
- **Cross-language inspiration** evident with Haskell, Agda, and SML design patterns being referenced as both positive examples and cautionary tales for OCaml language evolution ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59), [#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57))
repositories.contributors_summary: Active RFC discussions led by Gabriel Scherer and Alistair, with substantial design feedback from language committee members
repositories.contributors:
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) authored the new `val` declarations RFC ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59)), participated in forward declaration semantics discussions, and updated the RFC text to clarify non-binding status of extension proposals
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) authored and merged the conflict-of-interest policy PR establishing governance transparency requirements ([#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/55))
- [Jeremy Yallop](https://github.com/yallop) provided extensive analysis proposing alternative forward declaration semantics with Agda-style type recursion examples and implementation considerations ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) defended the tuple projections RFC implementation approach, engaging with maintainer feedback about tuple polymorphism requirements and type inference complexity ([#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57))
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) contributed formal semantics proposals for `val` declaration scoping using environment calculus notation and debated forward declaration behavior ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) suggested the `val rec` keyword design and proposed shorthand `val f = <def>` syntax, also cross-referenced related PR [ocaml/ocaml#12732](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/12732) ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) provided detailed design analysis drawing from Haskell experience, proposing unordered `and`-joined declaration blocks and raising concerns about scoped type variables ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) advocated for tighter coupling between `val` and `let` declarations, viewing them as syntactic sugar for type constraints rather than general forward declarations ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) raised implementation questions about tuple polymorphism runtime compilation strategies and canonical field ordering ([#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57))
- [Nicolas Jeannerod](https://github.com/Niols) shared experimental PPX implementation demonstrating feasibility of `val` declarations and expressed preference for the original proposal over forward declarations ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) contributed implementation suggestion for making `Array.Floatarray` more general using private type constraints ([#37](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/37))
- [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) expressed support for `val` declaration feature and asked clarifying questions about the `and`-joining proposal ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- [Didier Remy](https://github.com/diremy) questioned whether `val` declarations should be constrained to immediately precede definitions or could appear earlier in files ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- [Jacques Garrigue](https://github.com/garrigue) participated in discussions and was mentioned as having been part of synchronous meetings about the `val` declarations proposal ([#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))

repositories.brief_summary: Build system improvements and CI dependency updates
repositories.new_features_summary: Documentation restructuring and test infrastructure cleanup
repositories.new_features:
- Renamed main documentation file from `odoc.mld` to `index.mld`, replacing symlink with actual file for improved build compatibility ([d8460cd](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/commit/d8460cdaa2b91a03434a9a045d673703b7fabfb2))
- Removed obsolete symlinks in test infrastructure (`fonts`, `highlight.pack.js`, `katex.min.css`, `katex.min.js`, `odoc.css`) that were blocking Dune package management and Windows builds ([#1392](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1392))
repositories.activity_summary: Dependency upgrade PR opened while maintenance improvements merged
repositories.activity:
- [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) opened **GitHub Actions dependency update** to bump actions/checkout from version 5 to 6, which requires minimum Actions Runner version 2.329.0 for credential persistence under `$RUNNER_TEMP` ([#1393](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1393))
- [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) merged **build system maintenance** removing obsolete symlinks that caused issues with Dune package management and Windows compatibility, as these symlinks were no longer required after previous refactoring ([#1392](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1392))
repositories.contributors_summary: Sudha Parimala merged maintenance improvements with review from Jon Ludlam
repositories.contributors:

repositories.brief_summary: Package ecosystem growth with email/DNS stack updates, opam 2.5.0 release, cmdliner 2.1.0, and improved OCaml 5.4 compatibility
repositories.new_features_summary: opam 2.5.0 released, cmdliner 2.1.0 added, new conf-libclang versions, and OCaml 5.4.0 compatibility bounds
repositories.new_features:
- **opam 2.5.0** package manager released with 8 component packages ([#28978](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28978))
- **cmdliner 2.1.0** command-line interface library added ([#28962](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28962))
- **conf-libclang** versions 19 and 21 support added using generic configure script ([#28968](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28968), [#28950](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28950))
- **OCaml 5.4.0 compatibility** bounds added for bogue, why3, and boltzgen packages ([#28974](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28974), [#28973](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28973), [#28971](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28971))
- **MSys2 support improvements** with fixed side-conditions for conf-packages ([#28944](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28944))
- **Cross-platform build tools** with opam-build and opam-test 0.3.0 releases ([#28967](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28967))
repositories.activity_summary: Email protocol stack updates dominate merged work, with 18 open PRs awaiting merge including Melange 6.0.1 and dns 10.2.3

repositories.discussions_summary: Infrastructure concerns around archival planning, package versioning, and CI reliability
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Periodic archival run planning** discussed by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) for December snapshot with archival tool run, PR preparation, and testing repository until January deadline ([#28489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28489))
- **rocq-prover versioning confusion** raised by [Ralf Jung](https://github.com/RalfJung) where rocq-prover.9.0.0 package actually installs Rocq 9.1 due to unpinned dependencies ([#28994](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28994))
- **CI source fetching failures** investigated by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) for alt-ergo.1.01 and cmdliner.2.0.0 with curl exit code 6 errors on opam-ci workers affecting self-hosted packages ([#28966](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28966))
- **Distribution wiki documentation** enhancement requested by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) to add NixOS, Rocky Linux, and Linux Mint distribution entries plus correct Ubuntu os-family value ([#28930](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28930))
- **Windows mingw-w64-shims installation issue** resolved and closed by [Lukasz Stafiniak](https://github.com/lukstafi) after intermittent permission errors stopped occurring ([#27717](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27717))
- **conf-package lower bound CI failures** issue closed by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) after archival of old conf-gmp packages and addition of conf-libclang.21 ([#28541](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28541))
repositories.trends_summary: Email protocol stack maturation, OCaml 5.4 preparation, and improved cross-platform configuration

repositories.brief_summary: Backend optimization surge with 10 x86 peephole PRs, type system improvements, and new intrinsics support
repositories.new_features_summary: Manifest file support, 128-bit intrinsics, BMI/BMI2 ops, jkind normalization optimization, unboxed module elements
repositories.new_features:
- **Manifest file support** for compiler include paths via `-I-manifest` and `-H-manifest` flags, allowing specification of available files directly rather than entire directories ([#4986](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4986))
- **128-bit integer arithmetic intrinsics** including `add_int128`, `sub_int128`, `mul_int64` (signed/unsigned), compiling to efficient add/adc, sub/sbb, and imul/mul instructions ([#5025](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5025))
- **BMI/BMI2 intrinsics implementation** with support for POPCNT, LZCNT (now separate from BMI), and multiple return registers in simdgen ([#5065](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5065))
- **Jkind normalization fuel optimization** - runs out of fuel only once per jkind, reusing fuel cache when normalizing with additional types ([#5047](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5047), [#5009](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5009))
- **Unboxed elements at module top-level** now allowed after fixing cross-module inlining behavior ([#5064](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5064))
- **Skip mode hints** added in several missing locations to improve mode error diagnostics ([#5053](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5053))
- **Chamelon minimization** can now be stopped with Ctrl-C by replacing `Sys.command` with Unix module calls ([#5061](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5061))
- **Race condition fix** for `-dump-dir` flag when used with nonexistent paths in parallel builds ([#5010](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5010))
- **Classic mode approximations** now track kinds for non-Value variables, enabling proper mixed module block inlining ([#5058](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5058))
- **Repository cleanup** - boot directory removed, saving 5% of source repo size ([#5067](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5067)); .vscode directory now ignored ([#4186](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4186))
- **Debugging improvements** with new tests for C/OCaml interaction including runtime breakpoints and stack traces ([#5062](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5062))
- **IRC register allocator refactoring** - `irc_work_list` moved from instruction field to IRC state table ([#4594](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4594))
repositories.activity_summary: 26 new PRs opened including abstract kinds preparation, typed ARM64 DSL, and separability axis work; backend optimization continues
repositories.activity:
- **New PRs opened** this week include abstract kinds preparation by [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) ([#5070](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5070)), typed ARM64 DSL by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#5037](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5037)), separability axis scannable conversion by [Zack Eisbach](https://github.com/zackbach) ([#5031](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5031)), register allocation affinity support by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#5059](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5059)), and x86 peephole optimizations continuation ([#5063](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5063))
- **Backend optimization surge** led by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) with 10 merged PRs implementing x86 peephole rules for redundant comparison removal ([#5028](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5028)), MOV-to-LEA rewriting ([#5018](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5018)), MOV-to-XCHG optimization ([#5016](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5016)), useless move deletion ([#4985](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4985)), MOV chain optimization ([#4977](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4977)), infrastructure refactoring ([#5032](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5032), [#4975](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4975)), CI testing ([#4976](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4976)), and IRC refactoring ([#4594](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4594))
- **Type system evolution** with [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) optimizing jkind normalization fuel ([#5047](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5047), [#5009](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5009)) and environment fold operations ([#5066](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5066)), [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) re-enabling unboxed module elements ([#5064](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5064)), [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) adding staticity checking ([#5054](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5054)) and mode hints ([#5053](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5053)), and [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) fixing classic mode approximations ([#5058](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5058))
- **Intrinsics expansion** by [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat) adding 128-bit integer operations ([#5025](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5025)) and BMI/BMI2 support ([#5065](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5065))
- **Flambda2 cleanup** with [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) removing 3-year-old disabled code age relation join ([#5051](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5051)) and improving chamelon ([#5061](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5061)), [Nathanaëlle Courant](https://github.com/Ekdohibs) refactoring reaper code ([#5049](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5049), [#5038](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5038))
- **Ongoing work** includes reaper type rewriting ([#5043](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5043)), GADT with-bounds re-enablement ([#5046](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5046)), typed ARM64 DSL ([#5037](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5037)), flambda2 type interface ([#5050](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5050)), debugging improvements by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([#4916](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4916), [#4961](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4961), [#4928](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4928)), name mangling scheme by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) ([#4850](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4850)), and untagged int arrays by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) ([#4779](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4779), [#4643](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4643), [#4936](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4936))
- **Developer tooling improvements** including manifest files by [Andrei Odintsov](https://github.com/Forestryks) ([#4986](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4986)), magic number bump by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) ([#5048](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5048)), boot directory removal by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) ([#5067](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5067)), test fix by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) ([#5042](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5042)), and documentation typo fix by [BuzzY_](https://github.com/BuzzYbis) ([#5069](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5069))
repositories.trends_summary: Backend optimization focus, type system evolution, platform support expansion, and technical debt reduction
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Backend optimization momentum** with systematic x86 peephole work establishing patterns for instruction-level optimization including flag liveness analysis, pseudo-liveness tracking, and comprehensive CI testing
- **Type system maturation** through jkind normalization improvements, mode system refinements, and preparation for abstract kinds feature
- **Intrinsics library expansion** targeting both x86 (BMI/BMI2) and ARM64 platforms with focus on efficient compilation of low-level operations
- **Flambda2 consolidation** removing long-disabled features and refactoring for clarity while preparing for type rewriting capabilities
- **Developer experience focus** through repository cleanup (boot directory removal), tooling improvements (manifest files), and build system fixes
- **Cross-module optimization** work addressing mixed module blocks and classic mode approximation issues to improve inlining behavior
- **Platform parity efforts** with ongoing ARM64 DSL work and intrinsics additions to match x86 capabilities
