repositories.brief_summary: Merged OCaml 5.2.0minus-24 compiler changes and opened PR for jkind hover support
repositories.new_features_summary: Added jkind hover expansion, SIMD float16 types, Runtime_metaprogramming extension, and fixed documentation lookup prioritization
repositories.new_features:
- Added `Jkind.format_expanded` function to expand jkind abbreviations when hovering, enabling Merlin to show full expanded forms of jkind types rather than abbreviations ([#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
- Fixed **documentation lookup bug** where `.cms` files were incorrectly prioritized over `.cmti` files, causing wrong documentation to be displayed for stdlib modules ([55ec2f4](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/55ec2f413cdb75c8eed72e8b8fa752a2ae6ab216))
- Added support for new **SIMD float16 vector types** including `float16x8`, `float16x16`, and `float16x32` variants (both boxed and unboxed) in `Predef` module ([#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
- Added **Runtime_metaprogramming language extension** at Alpha maturity level, extending the set of experimental OCaml features available ([#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
- Updated **magic numbers** from 569 to 570 for all compiler artifact formats (cmi, ast_intf, ast_impl, cmt, cms, and index) to match upstream compiler changes ([00e7d73](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/00e7d7311d0e7ec8f13129bf437e76451d9ce9bb))
- Enhanced `Load_path.get_visible` to return both directories and basenames via new `dirs_and_files` record type, supporting manifest file handling ([#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
- Made type checking more **lazy** to improve performance when handling complex type signatures ([45b1502](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/45b1502f64ce8581014c2534ca5b821929b39baf))
- Added **lazy variants** of environment lookup functions (`find_value_by_name_lazy`, `find_module_by_name_lazy`, `find_modtype_by_name_lazy`) to defer substitution work ([#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
- Introduced new `fold_modules_lazy` and `fold_modtypes_lazy` functions in `Env` module for efficient traversal of module structures ([#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
repositories.activity_summary: Opened PR for jkind hover support; merged comprehensive OCaml 5.2.0minus-24 compiler update
repositories.activity:
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) **opened** [#200](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/200) to add **type hover support for jkinds**, enabling Merlin to display expanded jkind abbreviations when users hover over type expressions (opened November 21, updated this week)
- **Merged OCaml 5.2.0minus-24 compiler changes** into Merlin through [#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201) by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923), synchronizing with upstream compiler including handling of new `-I-manifest` and `-H-manifest` parameters (determined unnecessary for Merlin after discussion with [Andrei Odintsov](https://github.com/Forestryks)), resolving conflicts from parameterized module changes, and fixing type errors introduced by lazy type representation improvements
- Addressed **breaking changes** from multiple upstream OCaml PRs including handling `.cms` file generation for stdlib (previously only `.cmt` files existed), requiring prioritization order changes from `.cmsi > .cms > .cmti > .cmt` to properly prioritize `.cmti` files for documentation
- Updated **mode system** and **closure lock** handling throughout the type checker, including refactored `add_escape_lock`, `add_share_lock`, and `add_closure_lock` functions with revised `Mode.Hint.pinpoint` parameters
- Enhanced **jkind subsumption checking** by adding `level` parameter to `Layout.sub` function for improved type level tracking during unification
- Improved **error reporting** functions in `Env` and `Jkind.Violation` modules by adding `level` parameter to `report_error`, `report_lookup_error`, `report_with_offender`, and related functions for better diagnostic context
- Refactored **type marking infrastructure** in `Btype` module, replacing `unmark_iterators` with more flexible `type_iterators` that take `type_mark` parameter, and adding distinction between `type_iterators_full` and `type_iterators_without_type_expr`
- Updated test suite across multiple files including `function-recovery.t`, `mode-recovery.t`, `parameters.t`, `type-enclosing`, and `typing-recovery.t` to reflect new compiler behavior
repositories.trends_summary: Continued emphasis on lazy evaluation and performance optimization in type checking infrastructure
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Lazy type representation** becoming more prevalent throughout Merlin's codebase, with new `Subst.Lazy` module providing lazy variants of `value_description`, `module_declaration`, and `modtype_declaration` types to defer expensive substitution operations until needed
- **Jkind system maturation** continues with enhanced tooling support including hover capabilities and expanded formatting functions, making the advanced type system more accessible to developers
- **SIMD type support expansion** with addition of float16 variants completing the SIMD type coverage across different vector widths (128-bit, 256-bit, and 512-bit)
- **Mode system refinement** showing consolidation of various lock mechanisms (`escape_lock`, `share_lock`, `closure_lock`) under unified `Mode.Hint.pinpoint` abstraction for tracking mode constraints
- **Type-level performance optimization** through strategic laziness in type operations, visible in commits like "Make lazier" and the introduction of lazy lookup functions throughout the environment module
repositories.contributors_summary: Liam Stevenson authored all commits and opened both PRs; dkalinichenko-js provided code review
repositories.contributors:
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) authored the comprehensive OCaml 5.2.0minus-24 merge through 23 commits ([#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201)), including conflict resolution, type error fixes, test updates, and documentation bug fixes, and opened the jkind hover support PR ([#200](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/200))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) provided code review feedback on [#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201), confirming changes looked good and asking clarifying questions about specific test changes
- [Andrei Odintsov](https://github.com/Forestryks) ([@Forestryks](https://github.com/Forestryks)) participated in discussions about `-I-manifest` and `-H-manifest` parameter handling, helping determine that Merlin doesn't need to understand these new flags

repositories.brief_summary: Major package version bump to v0.18~preview.130.76+222 with Dune package management compatibility work and eio fixes
repositories.new_features_summary: Eio compatibility fix, sedlex 3.6 package added, ppxlib AST updates, notty-community terminal enhancements, js_of_ocaml patches
repositories.new_features:
- Fixed **eio.1.3+ox compatibility** with latest oxcaml by explicitly currying function application in eio_mock to avoid "surplus arguments" error ([#24](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/24), [89f9d1a](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/89f9d1a693401b3f9461983942ec32454c4d23e0))
- Added **sedlex 3.6+ox package** providing Unicode lexer generator with ppx syntax extension support ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))
- Updated **ppxlib 0.33.0+ox** with comprehensive AST patches for oxcaml compatibility including ast_999, migration paths, and pprintast support ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))
- Added **notty-community 0.2.4+ox** with terminal improvements including HREF support, cursor types, line-based diffing, fast TTY width, and multidomain safety ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))
- Updated **js_of_ocaml 6.0.1+ox** family packages with ocaml_version-ppx patch for compiler compatibility ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))
- Introduced multiple **new Jane Street packages** including capsule, capsule0, current_exe, curl_async, portable_lockfree_htbl, heterogeneous_list, ppx_int63_literal, sexp_type, unsafe_clear, and bonsai_term family packages (bonsai_term, bonsai_term_components, bonsai_term_examples, bonsai_term_test) ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))
repositories.activity_summary: Three new PRs opened for Dune package management compatibility (ocamlbuild, odoc-parser) and package updates; major version bump to v0.18~preview.130.76+222
repositories.activity:
- [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) opened **Dune package management compatibility** patch for ocamlbuild to address symlink limitation ([#21](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/21)), referencing upstream work at [ocaml/dune#12736](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12736)
- [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) opened **odoc-parser Dune compatibility** patch maintaining compatibility with Dune package management ([#22](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/22)), with related upstream proposal at [ocaml/odoc#1392](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1392)
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) opened PR adding **package updates** for ocamlbuild, async_ssl, alcotest, sedlex, topkg, and uutf to enable compilation of more upstream packages ([#23](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/23))
- **Major version bump** across 200+ Jane Street packages from v0.18~preview.130.55+197 to v0.18~preview.130.76+222 including async, bonsai, core, ppx suite, hardcaml family, and many others ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on Dune package management compatibility and maintaining oxcaml-specific patches for ecosystem packages
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Dune package management compatibility** emerging as priority with patches addressing symlink limitations and ensuring packages build with both Dune and opam ([#21](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/21), [#22](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/22))
- **Oxcaml-specific compatibility work** continuing with patches for ppxlib, eio, js_of_ocaml, and other core packages to maintain compatibility with oxcaml's modal type system extensions ([#24](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/24))
- **Regular preview releases** with version bump pattern v0.18~preview.130.76+222 indicating active development and testing cycle for Jane Street packages
repositories.contributors_summary: Anil Madhavapeddy merged eio fix and opened package updates PR; Sudha Parimala opened two Dune compatibility patches
repositories.contributors:
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) fixed eio.1.3+ox compatibility with oxcaml by addressing function currying requirements ([#24](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/24)), committed major package version bump to v0.18~preview.130.76+222 ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487)), and opened PR for package updates including ocamlbuild, async_ssl, alcotest, sedlex, topkg, and uutf ([#23](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/23))
- [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) contributed Dune package management compatibility patches for ocamlbuild addressing symlink limitation ([#21](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/21)) and odoc-parser ([#22](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/22)), participated in discussion about Dune incompatibility issues with reference to [ocaml/dune#12736](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12736)

group_summaries.brief_summary: Package ecosystem growth with opam 2.5.0 release, email protocol stack updates, and OCaml 5.4 compatibility work
group_summaries.new_features_summary: opam 2.5.0 released, cmdliner 2.1.0 added, conf-libclang 19/21 support, and OCaml.org tutorial improvements
group_summaries.new_features:
- **opam 2.5.0** package manager released with 8 component packages by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28978](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28978))
- **cmdliner 2.1.0** command-line interface library added by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28962](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28962))
- **conf-libclang** versions 19 and 21 support added using generic configure script by [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) and [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28968](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28968), [ocaml/opam-repository#28950](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28950))
- **OCaml 5.4.0 compatibility** bounds added for bogue, why3, and boltzgen packages by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28974](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28974), [ocaml/opam-repository#28973](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28973), [ocaml/opam-repository#28971](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28971))
- **MSys2 support improvements** with fixed side-conditions for conf-packages by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28944](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28944))
- **Cross-platform build tools** with opam-build and opam-test 0.3.0 releases by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28967](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28967))
- Fixed **typos in OCaml.org tutorial documentation** for Maps and Sets modules by [Rong "Mantle" Bao](https://github.com/CSharperMantle) ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3399](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3399))
- Updated **CI workflow** to use `actions/checkout@v6` across all GitHub Actions workflows by [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3401](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3401))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Package ecosystem expansion** with comprehensive email protocol stack updates from [Calascibetta Romain](https://github.com/dinosaure) covering SMTP, MIME, DKIM, DMARC, ARC, and SPF libraries ([ocaml/opam-repository#28992](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28992), [ocaml/opam-repository#28991](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28991), [ocaml/opam-repository#28982](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28982), [ocaml/opam-repository#28995](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28995), [ocaml/opam-repository#28980](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28980), [ocaml/opam-repository#28996](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28996))
- **Major tooling releases** including opam 2.5.0 by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28978](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28978)) and cmdliner 2.1.0 by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28962](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28962))
- **OCaml 5.4.0 preparation** accelerating with compatibility bounds and dependency fixes by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28974](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28974), [ocaml/opam-repository#28973](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28973), [ocaml/opam-repository#28971](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28971))
- **Melange ecosystem activity** with open PRs for Melange 6.0.1, reason 3.17.2, and melange-fetch updates by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) and [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) ([ocaml/opam-repository#29001](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29001), [ocaml/opam-repository#28999](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28999), [ocaml/opam-repository#28990](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28990))
- **OCaml.org content updates** with five new blog posts added to OCaml Planet and tutorial documentation improvements ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3400](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3400), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3402](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3402), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3403](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3403), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3404), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3399](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3399))
- **Cross-platform configuration improvements** with MSys2 fixes, new conf-libclang versions, and distribution-specific depext refinements by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28944](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28944), [ocaml/opam-repository#28968](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28968), [ocaml/opam-repository#28976](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28976), [ocaml/opam-repository#28989](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28989))
group_summaries.activity_summary: DNS stack updates pending, package ecosystem growth with 30+ merged releases, and infrastructure discussions
group_summaries.activity:
- **Newly opened PRs** include [dns 10.2.3](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29005) (13 packages) by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm), [Melange 6.0.1](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29001) by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro), [reason 3.17.2](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28999) by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro), [repr 0.8.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28963) (4 packages) by [Thomas Gazagnaire](https://github.com/samoht), [raylib/raygui 1.6.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29008) by [Tobias Mock](https://github.com/tjammer), [server-reason-react 0.4.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29006) and [quickjs 0.2.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29000) by [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx)
- **Email and network protocol stack** saw comprehensive updates from [Calascibetta Romain](https://github.com/dinosaure) with releases of colombe 0.12.1 for SMTP ([ocaml/opam-repository#28992](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28992)), mrmime 0.7.1 for MIME ([ocaml/opam-repository#28991](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28991)), dkim 0.9.0 for email authentication ([ocaml/opam-repository#28982](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28982)), dmarc 0.0.1 for policy enforcement ([ocaml/opam-repository#28995](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28995)), uspf 0.2.0 for SPF validation ([ocaml/opam-repository#28980](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28980)), arc 0.0.1 for authenticated chains ([ocaml/opam-repository#28996](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28996))
- **Package ecosystem growth** with goblint 2.7.1 static analyzer by [Simmo Saan](https://github.com/sim642) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28979](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28979)), slipshow 0.7.0 presentation tool by [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28970](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28970)), ocaml-protoc 4.0 by [Simon Cruanes](https://github.com/c-cube) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28902](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28902)), dream-html 3.11.2 by [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28954](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28954)), mirage 4.10.4 by [Reynir Björnsson](https://github.com/reynir) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28942](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28942))
- **Platform and tooling updates** with ocamlmig 5.4-20251020 migration tool ([ocaml/opam-repository#28965](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28965)), ocaml-solo5 1.2.0 unikernel runtime by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28964](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28964)), soupault 5.2.0 static site generator by [Daniil Baturin](https://github.com/dmbaturin) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28926](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28926))
- **Compatibility and build fixes** from [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) including ppx_repr upper bound for ppx_irmin ([ocaml/opam-repository#28993](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28993)), conf-libpcre failure messages for Centos 10 and OpenSUSE ([ocaml/opam-repository#28989](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28989)), conf-age epel-release depext for Centos ([ocaml/opam-repository#28976](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28976)), cmdliner 2.0.0 upper bound for runtime_event_tools ([ocaml/opam-repository#28972](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28972)), plus [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) fixing shcaml compatibility ([ocaml/opam-repository#28959](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28959))
- **OCaml Planet blog aggregation** added five new posts throughout the week covering collective knowledge systems, OCaml Weekly News, Jane Street's FPGA Advent challenge, Emacs LSP server integration, and OCaml 5.4 ARM32 support ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3400](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3400), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3402](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3402), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3403](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3403), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3404))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Package publication and documentation pipeline** operates between [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) for package releases and [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) for blog announcements and tutorials, with opam 2.5.0 release in repository ([ocaml/opam-repository#28978](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28978)) likely to be featured in future OCaml.org content
- **OCaml 5.4.0 compatibility preparation** work in opam-repository by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28974](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28974), [ocaml/opam-repository#28973](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28973), [ocaml/opam-repository#28971](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28971)) supports OCaml.org blog posts on ARM32 support discussed in Planet aggregation ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3404))
- **Tutorial documentation improvements** on OCaml.org ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3399](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3399)) complement package availability in opam-repository, ensuring users can discover and learn about Maps and Sets functionality
- **CI infrastructure alignment** with GitHub Actions updates to v6 on OCaml.org ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3401](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3401)) and opam-ci infrastructure discussions for opam-repository ([ocaml/opam-repository#28966](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28966))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Periodic archival run planning** discussed by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) for December snapshot with archival tool run, PR preparation, and testing repository until January deadline ([ocaml/opam-repository#28489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28489))
- **rocq-prover versioning confusion** raised by [Ralf Jung](https://github.com/RalfJung) where rocq-prover.9.0.0 package actually installs Rocq 9.1 due to unpinned dependencies ([ocaml/opam-repository#28994](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28994))
- **CI source fetching failures** investigated by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) for alt-ergo.1.01 and cmdliner.2.0.0 with curl exit code 6 errors on opam-ci workers affecting self-hosted packages ([ocaml/opam-repository#28966](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28966))
- **Distribution wiki documentation** enhancement requested by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) to add NixOS, Rocky Linux, and Linux Mint distribution entries plus correct Ubuntu os-family value ([ocaml/opam-repository#28930](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28930))
- **Windows mingw-w64-shims installation issue** resolved and closed by [Lukasz Stafiniak](https://github.com/lukstafi) after intermittent permission errors stopped occurring ([ocaml/opam-repository#27717](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27717))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Email and authentication protocol stack** reaching production maturity with coordinated releases of DKIM, DMARC, ARC, SPF validation, and SMTP/MIME libraries forming comprehensive email infrastructure from [Calascibetta Romain](https://github.com/dinosaure) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28982](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28982), [ocaml/opam-repository#28995](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28995), [ocaml/opam-repository#28996](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28996), [ocaml/opam-repository#28980](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28980), [ocaml/opam-repository#28992](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28992), [ocaml/opam-repository#28991](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28991))
- **OCaml 5.4.0 ecosystem preparation** accelerating with proactive upper bound additions and dependency fixes ensuring smooth transition by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28974](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28974), [ocaml/opam-repository#28973](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28973), [ocaml/opam-repository#28971](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28971))
- **Cross-platform configuration improvements** continuing with MSys2 side-condition fixes, new conf-libclang versions supporting LLVM 19 and 21, and distribution-specific depext refinements by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) and [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28944](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28944), [ocaml/opam-repository#28968](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28968), [ocaml/opam-repository#28950](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28950), [ocaml/opam-repository#28976](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28976), [ocaml/opam-repository#28989](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28989))
- **Melange ecosystem growth** with new releases of melange-fetch, quickjs bindings, server-reason-react, and upcoming Melange 6.0.1 by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) and [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28990](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28990), [ocaml/opam-repository#29000](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29000), [ocaml/opam-repository#29006](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29006), [ocaml/opam-repository#29001](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29001))
- **Package maintenance infrastructure** discussions around archival process, versioning clarity, and CI reliability improvements reflecting repository maturity ([ocaml/opam-repository#28489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28489), [ocaml/opam-repository#28994](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28994), [ocaml/opam-repository#28966](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28966))
- **Automated content aggregation** maintaining steady flow of community blog posts to OCaml.org Planet covering technical topics and ecosystem developments ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3400](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3400), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3402](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3402), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3403](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3403), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3404))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Dune package management maturation, opam 2.5.0 release, Rocq Prover integration, and LSP editor improvements
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Rocq build language, dune promotion preview, opam 2.5.0, LSP .merlin fallback, compiler warning defaults change
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Rocq Prover build language** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) via `(lang rocq)` for Rocq 9.0 and later, with Coq mode deprecated ([ocaml/dune#12035](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12035), [ocaml/dune#12793](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12793))
- **Dune promotion preview command** `dune promotion show` to preview corrected files before promotion ([ocaml/dune#12669](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12669))
- **Dune compiler warning defaults changed** for language 3.21+ to match OCaml compiler defaults, with `%{dune-warnings}` variable for stricter warnings ([ocaml/dune#12766](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12766))
- **Dune dev-tool lock directory variable** `%{dev-tool-lock-dir}` and relocation to hidden `.dune/dev-tools-locks/` folder ([ocaml/dune#12779](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12779), [ocaml/dune#12671](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12671))
- **Dune SSH repository URLs** documentation for Git-based package repositories ([ocaml/dune#12790](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12790))
- **opam 2.5.0 final release** with performance optimizations in version comparison and cache loading, plus improved error handling for `opam init --config` ([ocaml/opam#6813](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6813), [ocaml/opam#5979](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/5979), [ocaml/opam#6515](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6515))
- **LSP .merlin fallback** automatically using `.merlin` configuration when no `dune-project` file exists, improving non-Dune project support ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1563](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1563))
- **LSP Dune package management installation** documentation with `dune tools install ocamllsp` guidance ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1573](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1573))
- **odoc documentation restructuring** renaming main file from `odoc.mld` to `index.mld` and removing obsolete symlinks blocking Dune package management ([ocaml/odoc#1392](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/pull/1392))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Major releases and integrations**: [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) shipped version 2.5.0 ([ocaml/opam#6813](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6813)), [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) integrated Rocq Prover language support across 687 files ([ocaml/dune#12035](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12035))
- **Package management focus**: [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) focused on UX improvements with 12 new package management issues opened including CLI enhancements ([ocaml/dune#12819](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12819)), dependency notifications ([ocaml/dune#12828](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12828)), and better error messages ([ocaml/dune#12802](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12802))
- **Editor integration improvements**: [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) refined signature help behavior ([ocaml/merlin#1997](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/pull/1997)), [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) added natural .merlin fallback ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1563](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1563))
- **Build system maintenance**: [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) removed Windows-incompatible symlinks ([ocaml/odoc#1392](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/pull/1392)), [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) optimized version comparison to be allocation-free ([ocaml/opam#6515](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6515))
- **Runtime platform expansion**: [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) added runtime improvements preparing for Deno support ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2132](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2132))
- **No activity**: [ocaml/ocamlfind](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind), [ocaml/opam-file-format](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-file-format), and [ocaml-dune/spawn](https://github.com/ocaml-dune/spawn) had no changes this week
group_summaries.activity_summary: 17 new Dune PRs focused on package management UX, opam environment refinement discussions, LSP Stdune removal continues
group_summaries.activity:
- **Dune package management expansion** with 17 new PRs opened including delayed URL resolution ([ocaml/dune#12829](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12829)), improved error messages for `(pkg enabled)` ([ocaml/dune#12802](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12802)), network caps tracking ([ocaml/dune#12787](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12787)), and OxCaml project documentation ([ocaml/dune#12780](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12780))
- **opam environment management refinement** discussions about env_hook PATH behavior ([ocaml/opam#6815](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6815)), shell completion variables PR ([ocaml/opam#6812](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6812)), and opam show I/O optimization ([ocaml/opam#6818](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6818))
- **opam platform compatibility** issues with AppArmor on KDE Neon affecting sandboxing ([ocaml/opam#6820](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6820)), MSYS2 build failures ([ocaml/opam#6803](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6803))
- **LSP Stdune dependency removal** with three refactoring PRs merged eliminating `Stdune.List` ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1480](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1480)), `Stdune.Io` ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1404)), and code generator cleanup ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1400](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1400))
- **LSP OCaml 4.14 backport** opened by [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) including Yojson 3 compatibility, hover fixes, and configurable code-lens ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1574](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1574))
- **Merlin signature help refinements** preventing unwanted triggers on function names ([ocaml/merlin#1997](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/pull/1997)) and draft support for `let ... in` bindings ([ocaml/merlin#2009](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/pull/2009))
- **Merlin C code quality** improvements for BSD socket handling and Windows error reporting ([ocaml/merlin#1998](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/pull/1998))
- **js_of_ocaml Deno preparation** with runtime improvements across 7 files ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2132](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2132))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Dune package management compatibility** work in [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) removing symlinks that blocked Dune pkg ([ocaml/odoc#1392](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/pull/1392)), supporting Dune's package management rollout
- **Installation workflow documentation** by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) spanning [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) opam-alongside-pkg guide ([ocaml/dune#12761](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12761)) and [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) Dune tools installation instructions ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1573](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1573))
- **Compiler warning alignment** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) reverting to OCaml compiler defaults ([ocaml/dune#12766](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12766)), reducing tool-specific conventions
- **GitHub Actions dependency updates** coordinated by [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) across [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) ([ocaml/dune#12778](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12778)), [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) ([ocaml/merlin#2008](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/pull/2008)), [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) ([ocaml/odoc#1393](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/pull/1393)), [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) ([ocaml/opam#6811](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6811)), and [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2130](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2130))
- **Merlin library usage** in LSP with version compatibility discussions for OCaml 4.14 backport requiring merlin-lib 4.19-414 ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1574](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1574))
- **opam 2.5.0 release impact** on Dune with regression affecting macOS 10.6.8 builds reported ([ocaml/opam#6822](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6822))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **OxCaml project setup** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) generated 43 comments on best practices for Dune pkg configuration ([ocaml/dune#12780](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12780))
- **opam env_hook aggressiveness** raised by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) about `PROMPT_COMMAND` forcing opam paths to dominate `$PATH`, preventing user overrides ([ocaml/opam#6815](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6815))
- **Package management error messaging** with 22 comments debating appropriate messages when `(pkg enabled)` appears in wrong files ([ocaml/dune#12802](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12802))
- **Non-ASCII version handling** with 23 comments on improving error messages for Unicode in dune-project files ([ocaml/dune#12794](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12794))
- **DUNE_CACHE_HOME variable** long-running discussion from April with 24 comments on cache directory configuration ([ocaml/dune#11612](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11612))
- **Compiler warning defaults** with 13 comments discussing impact of reverting to OCaml defaults ([ocaml/dune#12766](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12766))
- **opam sandboxing on KDE Neon** with bwrap loopback errors resolved by removing AppArmor profile ([ocaml/opam#6820](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6820))
- **Missing repository warnings** suggestion to warn when creating switches without default repository ([ocaml/opam#6816](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6816))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Package management maturation** across the ecosystem with [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) seeing 12 new package management issues focused on UX ([ocaml/dune#12819](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12819), [ocaml/dune#12828](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12828)), [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) 2.5.0 release with performance improvements ([ocaml/opam#6515](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6515)), and [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) removing compatibility blockers ([ocaml/odoc#1392](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/pull/1392))
- **Documentation expansion** with 6 new documentation requests in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) covering workflows ([ocaml/dune#12761](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12761)), environment variables ([ocaml/dune#12792](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12792)), and repository URLs ([ocaml/dune#12790](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12790)), plus installation guides in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1573](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1573))
- **Environment management refinement** emerging in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) with env_hook behavior concerns ([ocaml/opam#6815](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6815)), shell completion variables ([ocaml/opam#6812](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6812)), and stale variable cleanup ([ocaml/opam#6455](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6455))
- **Dependency reduction initiatives** in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) systematically removing Stdune ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1480](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1480), [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1404)), [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) removing experimental libraries ([ocaml/dune#12765](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12765))
- **Editor integration improvements** across [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) signature help ([ocaml/merlin#1997](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/pull/1997)) and [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) .merlin fallback ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1563](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1563)) for better developer experience
- **Platform compatibility focus** with [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) addressing KDE Neon AppArmor ([ocaml/opam#6820](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6820)) and MSYS2 issues ([ocaml/opam#6803](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6803)), [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) BSD and Windows fixes ([ocaml/merlin#1998](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/pull/1998)), [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) Windows symlink removal ([ocaml/odoc#1392](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/pull/1392))
- **Proof system transition** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) from Coq to Rocq with comprehensive language support ([ocaml/dune#12035](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12035)) and formal Coq deprecation ([ocaml/dune#12793](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12793))
- **Performance optimization** continuing in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) with allocation-free comparisons ([ocaml/opam#6515](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6515)), I/O reduction ([ocaml/opam#6818](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6818)), and HTTP repository redesign work ([ocaml/opam#6625](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6625))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Compiler backend surge with 10 x86 optimizations, type system improvements, Merlin sync to 5.2.0minus-24, and ecosystem compatibility work
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Manifest files, 128-bit intrinsics, BMI/BMI2 ops, jkind hover in Merlin, eio compatibility, new Jane Street packages
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Manifest file support** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) via `-I-manifest` and `-H-manifest` flags allows specification of available files directly rather than entire directories ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4986](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4986))
- **128-bit integer arithmetic intrinsics** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) including `add_int128`, `sub_int128`, `mul_int64` operations compiling to efficient add/adc, sub/sbb, and imul/mul instructions ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5025](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5025))
- **BMI/BMI2 intrinsics implementation** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with POPCNT, LZCNT support and multiple return registers in simdgen ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5065](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5065))
- **Jkind hover expansion** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) via `Jkind.format_expanded` function enables displaying full expanded forms of jkind types rather than abbreviations ([oxcaml/merlin#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
- **SIMD float16 vector types** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) including `float16x8`, `float16x16`, and `float16x32` variants added to `Predef` module ([oxcaml/merlin#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
- **Runtime_metaprogramming language extension** at Alpha maturity level added to [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) extending experimental OCaml features ([oxcaml/merlin#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
- **Lazy type representation** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with new `find_value_by_name_lazy`, `find_module_by_name_lazy`, `find_modtype_by_name_lazy` functions and `fold_modules_lazy`/`fold_modtypes_lazy` for efficient traversal ([oxcaml/merlin#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
- **Unboxed elements at module top-level** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) now allowed after fixing cross-module inlining behavior ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5064](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5064))
- **Jkind normalization fuel optimization** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) runs out of fuel only once per jkind, reusing fuel cache when normalizing with additional types ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5047](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5047), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5009](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5009))
- **Eio compatibility fix** in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) for eio.1.3+ox with oxcaml by explicitly currying function application in eio_mock ([oxcaml/opam-repository#24](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/24))
- **New Jane Street packages** in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) including capsule, current_exe, curl_async, portable_lockfree_htbl, heterogeneous_list, ppx_int63_literal, sexp_type, unsafe_clear, and bonsai_term family ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))
- **Sedlex 3.6+ox package** added to [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) providing Unicode lexer generator with ppx syntax extension support ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))
- **Skip mode hints** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) added in several missing locations to improve mode error diagnostics ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5053](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5053))
- **Chamelon minimization Ctrl-C support** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) by replacing `Sys.command` with Unix module calls ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5061](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5061))
- **Documentation lookup fix** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) where `.cms` files were incorrectly prioritized over `.cmti` files, causing wrong documentation to be displayed for stdlib modules ([55ec2f4](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/55ec2f413cdb75c8eed72e8b8fa752a2ae6ab216))
group_summaries.activity_summary: 26 new PRs in oxcaml compiler including abstract kinds prep, typed ARM64 DSL, and register allocation work; 3 PRs in opam-repository for Dune compatibility
group_summaries.activity:
- **X86 backend optimization surge** led by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with 10 merged PRs implementing peephole rules for redundant comparison removal ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5028](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5028)), MOV-to-LEA rewriting ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5018](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5018)), MOV-to-XCHG optimization ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5016](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5016)), useless move deletion ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4985](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4985)), MOV chain optimization ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4977](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4977)), infrastructure refactoring ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5032](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5032), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4975](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4975)), CI testing ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4976](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4976)), and IRC refactoring ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4594](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4594))
- **Type system evolution** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) optimizing environment fold operations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5066](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5066)), [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) adding staticity checking ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5054](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5054)) and removing extension.escape ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5055](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5055)), [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) fixing classic mode approximations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5058](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5058))
- **Merlin compiler sync** with [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) merging OCaml 5.2.0minus-24 changes through 23 commits in [oxcaml/merlin#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201), resolving conflicts from parameterized module changes, fixing type errors from lazy type representation improvements, and updating mode system and closure lock handling
- **Flambda2 cleanup** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) removing 3-year-old disabled code age relation join ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5051](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5051)), [Nathanaëlle Courant](https://github.com/Ekdohibs) refactoring reaper code ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5049](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5049), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5038](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5038))
- **Dune package management compatibility** in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) with [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) opening patches for ocamlbuild to address symlink limitation ([oxcaml/opam-repository#21](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/21), referencing [ocaml/dune#12736](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12736)) and odoc-parser ([oxcaml/opam-repository#22](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/22), related to [ocaml/odoc#1392](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1392))
- **Major package version bump** in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) across 200+ Jane Street packages from v0.18~preview.130.55+197 to v0.18~preview.130.76+222 ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))
- **Ongoing work** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) includes abstract kinds preparation by [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5070](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5070)), typed ARM64 DSL by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5037](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5037)), separability axis work by [Zack Eisbach](https://github.com/zackbach) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5031](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5031)), register allocation affinity by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5059](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5059), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5063](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5063)), reaper type rewriting by [Nathanaëlle Courant](https://github.com/Ekdohibs) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5043](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5043)), GADT with-bounds by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5046](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5046)), debugging improvements by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4916](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4916), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4961](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4961), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4928](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4928)), and untagged int arrays by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4779](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4779), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4643](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4643), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4936](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4936))
- **Repository cleanup** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) removing boot directory saving 5% of repo size ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5067](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5067)), [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ignoring .vscode directory ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4186](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4186))
- **Jkind hover support** opened by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) in [oxcaml/merlin#200](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/200) to display expanded jkind abbreviations when hovering over type expressions
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Compiler-Merlin synchronization** with [oxcaml/merlin#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201) merging OCaml 5.2.0minus-24 changes including manifest file parameters ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4986](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4986)), jkind normalization optimizations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5047](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5047), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5009](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5009)), and lazy environment operations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5066](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5066))
- **Jkind system evolution** across [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) and [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with fuel optimization in compiler ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5047](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5047)) coordinating with hover expansion in editor tooling ([oxcaml/merlin#200](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/200))
- **Ecosystem compatibility patches** in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) supporting compiler features with eio currying fix ([oxcaml/opam-repository#24](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/24)), ppxlib AST updates, and js_of_ocaml patches ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))
- **Type system infrastructure** improvements in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) enabling lazy evaluation patterns that propagated to [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with new `Subst.Lazy` module and lazy lookup functions ([oxcaml/merlin#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
- **Dune compatibility initiative** in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) coordinating with upstream [ocaml/dune#12736](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12736) and [ocaml/odoc#1392](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1392) to ensure packages build with both Dune package management and opam ([oxcaml/opam-repository#21](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/21), [oxcaml/opam-repository#22](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/22))
- **Unboxed module elements coordination** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) reverting initial implementation ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5056](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5056)) followed by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) fixing cross-module inlining and re-enabling ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5064](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5064))
- **Magic number synchronization** across [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) and [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with bump to 570 for 5.2.0minus-24 release ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5048](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5048)) matching Merlin update ([00e7d73](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/00e7d7311d0e7ec8f13129bf437e76451d9ce9bb))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Backend optimization momentum** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with systematic x86 peephole work establishing patterns for instruction-level optimization including flag liveness analysis, pseudo-liveness tracking, and comprehensive CI testing ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5028](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5028), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5018](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5018), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5016](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5016), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4985](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4985), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4977](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4977))
- **Type system maturation** across [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) and [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) through jkind normalization improvements ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5047](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5047)), mode system refinements ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5053](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5053), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5058](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5058)), preparation for abstract kinds ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5070](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5070)), and tooling enhancements ([oxcaml/merlin#200](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/200))
- **Lazy evaluation paradigm** spreading throughout codebase with lazy type representation in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) via `Subst.Lazy` module ([oxcaml/merlin#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201)), lazy environment lookups, and deferred substitution operations to improve performance with complex type signatures
- **Intrinsics library expansion** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) targeting both x86 (BMI/BMI2) and ARM64 platforms with focus on efficient compilation of low-level operations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5025](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5025), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5065](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5065)), and ongoing ARM64 intrinsics work ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5024](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5024))
- **Flambda2 consolidation** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) removing long-disabled features ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5051](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5051)), refactoring for clarity ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5049](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5049), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5038](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5038)), while preparing for type rewriting capabilities ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5043](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5043), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5050](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5050))
- **Dune package management compatibility** emerging as priority in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) with patches addressing symlink limitations and ensuring packages build with both systems ([oxcaml/opam-repository#21](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/21), [oxcaml/opam-repository#22](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/22)), coordinating with upstream [ocaml/dune#12736](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12736) and [ocaml/odoc#1392](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1392)
- **Cross-module optimization** work in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) addressing mixed module blocks and classic mode approximation issues to improve inlining behavior ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5058](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5058), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5064](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5064))
- **Developer experience focus** with repository cleanup ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5067](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5067)), tooling improvements ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4986](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4986)), build system fixes ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5010](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5010)), and debugging enhancements ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5062](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5062), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4916](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4916))
- **Regular preview releases** in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) with version bump pattern v0.18~preview.130.76+222 indicating active development and testing cycle for Jane Street packages ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Seven PRs merged with relocatable installations, atomic record fields, and String enhancements; active RFC discussions on val declarations
group_summaries.new_features_summary: String predicates, atomic record fields, relocatable ld.conf, native dynlink cleanup, RFC conflict-of-interest policy
group_summaries.new_features:
- Added **String.{drop,take,cut}_{first,last}_while** functions for predicate-based string splitting operations in both `String` and `StringLabels` modules ([ocaml/ocaml#14362](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14362))
- Implemented **atomic record fields** enabling lock-free concurrent programming with per-field atomic operations ([ocaml/ocaml#13404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13404))
- Enhanced **native dynlink** to call `dlclose` on dynamically loaded objects when errors occur, preventing resource leaks ([ocaml/ocaml#14391](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14391))
- Improved **debugger error messages** to display specific information about incorrect or missing magic numbers rather than generic errors ([ocaml/ocaml#14375](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14375))
- Introduced **relocatable OCaml installations** with explicit relative paths in `ld.conf` - paths like `.` and `..` now resolve relative to the ld.conf directory, and the default ld.conf uses relative rather than absolute paths ([ocaml/ocaml#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243))
- Added **--with-additional-stublibsdir** configure option to prepend custom directories to ld.conf, and stublibs subdirectory is no longer created when building with --disable-shared ([ocaml/ocaml#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243))
- Implemented **multiple ld.conf loading** - the runtime now loads from all of $OCAMLLIB/ld.conf, $CAMLLIB/ld.conf, and standard_library_default/ld.conf rather than just the first found ([ocaml/ocaml#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243))
- Added **external types documentation** - new manual chapter explaining external types for FFI-populated values with examples for predefined types like float, string, and array ([ocaml/ocaml#13994](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13994))
- Updated **GADT tutorial** in manual to avoid using abstract types as indices, demonstrating proper usage with external types ([ocaml/ocaml#13994](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13994))
- Enhanced **ld.conf parsing** robustness - now handles CRLF line endings consistently on both Windows and Unix, and ocamlc uses the same C primitive-based parser as the runtime ([ocaml/ocaml#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243))
- Documented **Ptype_external** in parsetree.mli to clarify the AST representation of external type declarations ([ocaml/ocaml#13994](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13994))
- **Transparency policy for conflicts of interest** added to the OCaml Language Committee governance, requiring members to disclose conflicts when they belong to the same institution as proposal submitters or have financial ties, and establishing that conflicted members cannot serve as shepherds ([ocaml/RFCs#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/55))
- **Affiliation field** added to the committee member table, documenting institutional affiliations including Inria Paris, Jane Street, LexiFi, Meta, and University of Cambridge ([ocaml/RFCs#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/55))
group_summaries.activity_summary: 36 open PRs in ocaml/ocaml covering relocatable installations, atomic operations, String module enhancements; new val declarations RFC
group_summaries.activity:
- **Relocatable OCaml initiative** by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) with merged foundation ([ocaml/ocaml#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243)) and four follow-up PRs for --with-relative-libdir ([ocaml/ocaml#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244)), searching and suffixing ([ocaml/ocaml#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245)), opam integration ([ocaml/ocaml#14246](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14246)), and switch management ([ocaml/ocaml#14247](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14247))
- **Atomic operations expansion** including merged atomic record fields by [@clef-men](https://github.com/clef-men) ([ocaml/ocaml#13404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13404)), open atomic arrays PR ([ocaml/ocaml#14380](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14380)), and [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) working on Atomic.modify/modify_get ([ocaml/ocaml#10798](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/10798)), concurrent lazy thunks with Lazy.Atomic_repeating ([ocaml/ocaml#14043](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14043)) and Lazy.Concurrent_blocking ([ocaml/ocaml#14393](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14393))
- **String module enhancements** by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) with merged predicate-based functions ([ocaml/ocaml#14362](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14362)) and open PR adding find_{first,last}_index and related search functions ([ocaml/ocaml#14381](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14381))
- **Compiler tooling improvements** including [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) advancing structured diagnostics ([ocaml/ocaml#13766](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13766)), spellchecking hints for module errors ([ocaml/ocaml#14330](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14330)), and cmt file environment stripping ([ocaml/ocaml#14373](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14373))
- **Type system enhancements** with [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) refactoring type_let into separate nonrec/rec functions ([ocaml/ocaml#14394](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14394)) and removing let rec module support ([ocaml/ocaml#14388](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14388)), plus [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) adding Set/Map.S.get_singleton ([ocaml/ocaml#14121](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14121))
- **Pattern matching improvements** by [@Alex1005a](https://github.com/Alex1005a) fixing exhaustiveness checking for GADTs indexed by non-overlapping polymorphic variants ([ocaml/ocaml#14379](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14379))
- **Developer experience** with [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) adding AI.md guidelines ([ocaml/ocaml#14383](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14383)), [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) improving Git source archives ([ocaml/ocaml#14152](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14152)), and [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) integrating Merlin typing recovery ([ocaml/ocaml#14241](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14241))
- **Runtime and GC work** including [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) using memprof status field for minimal sampling ([ocaml/ocaml#14384](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14384)), [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) updating young-pointers after barrier ([ocaml/ocaml#14306](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14306)), and [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) adding named GC parameters mechanism ([ocaml/ocaml#14367](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14367))
- **Platform compatibility** with [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) fixing Windows socketpair AF_UNIX emulation ([ocaml/ocaml#13450](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13450)) and improving AsciiDoc documentation ([ocaml/ocaml#14392](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14392)), [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) updating shell scripts to use /usr/bin/env bash ([ocaml/ocaml#14398](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14398)), and [Samuel Bronson](https://github.com/SamB) checking getentropy declaration ([ocaml/ocaml#14382](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14382))
- **New RFC for val declarations in structures** opened by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) proposing syntax to write type signatures alongside definitions, similar to Haskell-style type annotations, sparking extensive discussion about forward declarations, scoping semantics, and integration with mutual recursion ([ocaml/RFCs#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- **Tuple projections RFC** continues with active debate between [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) and maintainers about whether unlabeled numeric projections should require tuple polymorphism or rely on known type information, with consensus favoring polymorphic approach for unlabeled projections ([ocaml/RFCs#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57))
- **Atomic record fields RFC** updated with note about atomic arrays implementation, cross-referencing [ocaml/ocaml#14380](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14380) ([ocaml/RFCs#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/39))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Atomic record fields** coordination between merged implementation in [ocaml/ocaml#13404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13404) by [@clef-men](https://github.com/clef-men) and ongoing RFC documentation in [ocaml/RFCs#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/39), with the RFC updated to cross-reference the atomic arrays implementation PR [ocaml/ocaml#14380](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/14380)
- **Language design discussions** in [ocaml/RFCs#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59) about val declarations referencing implementation considerations from past PRs like [ocaml/ocaml#12732](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/12732) mentioned by [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25)
- **Gabriel Scherer** active across both repositories - contributing merged external types documentation in [ocaml/ocaml#13994](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13994) while authoring the new val declarations RFC in [ocaml/RFCs#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59)
- **Florian Angeletti** merged governance improvements in [ocaml/RFCs#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/55) establishing conflict-of-interest policy while advancing compiler diagnostics in [ocaml/ocaml#13766](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13766) and [ocaml/ocaml#14330](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14330)
- **Alistair** contributing to both tuple projections RFC debate in [ocaml/RFCs#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57) and compiler type system refactoring in [ocaml/ocaml#14394](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14394) and [ocaml/ocaml#14388](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14388)
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Forward declarations vs. type ascriptions** debated extensively for val declarations RFC, with [Jeremy Yallop](https://github.com/yallop) proposing an alternative interpretation where `val` serves as forward declarations to introduce recursion (similar to Agda), enabling recursive bindings between different kinds of items like types and modules, while [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) proposed that `val` should primarily serve as type ascriptions that don't introduce recursion ([ocaml/RFCs#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- **Scoping semantics for val bindings** discussed with [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) proposing that forward declarations should be removed from scope in the next definition to avoid unintended recursive references, while others debated whether this creates confusing semantics ([ocaml/RFCs#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- **Syntax placement preferences** emerged with [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) advocating for `val` declarations to immediately precede their corresponding `let` or `and` bindings rather than being grouped at the top, viewing this as syntactic sugar for type constraints that improves code legibility ([ocaml/RFCs#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- **Alternative syntaxes** proposed including [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25)'s `val rec` keyword to explicitly mark forward declarations that introduce recursion, and [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere)'s unordered `and`-joined blocks mixing `val`, `let`, and `let rec` declarations ([ocaml/RFCs#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- **Locally abstract types in signatures** questioned by [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) regarding scoping across `val` and `let` boundaries, expressing concerns about "spooky action at a distance" similar to Haskell's deprecated `-XScopedTypeVariables` extension ([ocaml/RFCs#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59))
- **Tuple polymorphism implementation challenges** raised by [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) questioning how runtime projection would work for flexible tuples with labeled and unlabeled fields, asking whether canonical ordering or dynamic lookup would be required ([ocaml/RFCs#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57))
- **Type inference complexity** debated with [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) arguing that tuple polymorphism would be invasive to the type checker and preferring improvements to known-type-information propagation instead, while maintainers indicated numeric projections without polymorphism are non-intuitive ([ocaml/RFCs#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57))
- **String module enhancement proposal** by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) discussing comprehensive improvements to the String API, which led to merged PRs [ocaml/ocaml#14362](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14362) and ongoing work in [ocaml/ocaml#14381](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14381) ([ocaml/ocaml#14137](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/discussions/14137))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Relocatable OCaml** becoming a major focus with comprehensive work spanning build system, installation, and package management to enable portable OCaml installations across different directory structures ([ocaml/ocaml#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243), [ocaml/ocaml#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244), [ocaml/ocaml#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245), [ocaml/ocaml#14246](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14246), [ocaml/ocaml#14247](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14247))
- **Concurrent programming primitives** expanding with atomic record fields merged in [ocaml/ocaml#13404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13404), atomic arrays in development via [ocaml/ocaml#14380](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14380), and multiple concurrent lazy evaluation strategies being explored for lock-free data structures ([ocaml/ocaml#14043](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14043), [ocaml/ocaml#14393](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14393), [ocaml/ocaml#10798](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/10798))
- **Standard library ergonomics** improving with systematic additions to String module for common text processing operations via [ocaml/ocaml#14362](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14362) and [ocaml/ocaml#14381](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14381), reflecting broader effort discussed in [ocaml/ocaml#14137](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/discussions/14137) to make standard library more practical
- **Developer experience focus** with structured diagnostics ([ocaml/ocaml#13766](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13766)), better error messages, spellchecking hints ([ocaml/ocaml#14330](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14330)), and IDE integration improvements via [ocaml/ocaml#14241](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14241) making the compiler more helpful and approachable
- **Type system expressiveness** features gaining momentum with proposals for `val` declarations in [ocaml/RFCs#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59), tuple projections in [ocaml/RFCs#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57), and atomic record fields in [ocaml/RFCs#39](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/39) all aiming to make OCaml's type system more expressive while maintaining backward compatibility and ergonomic syntax
- **Governance transparency** improvements formalized with the conflict-of-interest policy in [ocaml/RFCs#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/55) reflecting the committee's effort to balance community representation while being explicit about institutional affiliations and potential biases
- **Documentation completeness** addressing gaps in manual coverage of language features, particularly around external types via [ocaml/ocaml#13994](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13994), GADTs, and newer additions like immutable arrays ([ocaml/ocaml#14397](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14397), [ocaml/ocaml#14386](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14386))
- **AI-assisted contribution guidelines** emerging with dedicated documentation in [ocaml/ocaml#14383](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14383) to help contributors use AI tools effectively while maintaining code quality standards
- **Cross-language inspiration** evident in RFCs with Haskell, Agda, and SML design patterns being referenced as both positive examples and cautionary tales for OCaml language evolution in discussions around [ocaml/RFCs#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59) and [ocaml/RFCs#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/57)

weekly_summary.brief_summary: opam 2.5.0 released, atomic record fields merged, String module enhanced, compiler backend optimized with 10 x86 improvements
weekly_summary.new_features_summary: opam 2.5.0, atomic record fields, String predicates, relocatable ld.conf, jkind hover, 128-bit intrinsics, Rocq build language
weekly_summary.new_features:
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **opam 2.5.0** package manager released with 8 component packages (opam-client, opam-core, opam-devel, opam-format, opam-installer, opam-repository, opam-solver, opam-state) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) in [ocaml/opam-repository#28978](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28978), featuring performance optimizations in version comparison and cache loading [ocaml/opam#6515](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6515), improved error handling for `opam init --config` [ocaml/opam#5979](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/5979), and enhanced repository handling [ocaml/opam#6813](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6813)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **String predicate functions** added including `String.{drop,take,cut}_{first,last}_while` for predicate-based string splitting in both `String` and `StringLabels` modules by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) in [ocaml/ocaml#14362](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14362)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Atomic record fields** implementation enabling lock-free concurrent programming with per-field atomic operations by [@clef-men](https://github.com/clef-men) in [ocaml/ocaml#13404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13404)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Relocatable OCaml installations** with explicit relative paths in `ld.conf` where paths like `.` and `..` now resolve relative to the ld.conf directory by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) in [ocaml/ocaml#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243), including multiple ld.conf loading from `$OCAMLLIB/ld.conf`, `$CAMLLIB/ld.conf`, and `standard_library_default/ld.conf` and `--with-additional-stublibsdir` configure option
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Native dynlink cleanup** to call `dlclose` on dynamically loaded objects when errors occur, preventing resource leaks by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) in [ocaml/ocaml#14391](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14391)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Debugger error messages** enhanced to display specific information about incorrect or missing magic numbers rather than generic errors in [ocaml/ocaml#14375](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14375)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **External types documentation** added with new manual chapter explaining external types for FFI-populated values with examples for predefined types like float, string, and array by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) in [ocaml/ocaml#13994](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13994)
